title: Married couple died in 'suicide pact' amid fears of blackmail and £50k debt
text:
A married couple died in a suicide pact after blackmail and debt fears Credit: BPM Media A married couple died in a suicide pact after the husband wrongly feared he was being blackmailed and was £50,000 in debt, an inquest heard.
61-year-old Linda Ordinans died of head injuries consistent with being hit with a hammer.
Her body was found at her Wolverhampton home covered in blankets and two bouquets of flowers.
Her husband Nigel, who was 63, was found decapitated in his car 200 miles away in Kent.
Black Country Coroner’s Court heard that Mr Ordinans left a note next to his wife’s body saying he was £50,000 in debt after a dispute with his former employer, Marston’s brewery.
He said he was being blackmailed and the couple had agreed a suicide pact.
But West Midlands Police found no evidence of a dispute or any money issues.
Flowers were left for the married couple Credit: BPM Media Det Sgt Ian Wilkins, of the force’s homicide team, said:
He feared he was going to be left homeless through legal fees in a dispute over hearing loss with Marston’s.
“But Marstons said there was no dispute and he didn’t owe them any money.
“He also believed his computer has been compromised and he was being blackmailed but an investigation revealed this was not the case.”
– Det Sgt Ian Wilkins Coroner Zafar Siddique was told that Mr Ordinans called Kent Police just after midnight on December 8 last year saying he had killed his wife.
He was later found dead in his car in Dover. Investigations revealed no history of domestic violence and no issues with his mental health.
Mr Siddique described this case as "tragic."
 West Midlands Wolverhampton
